game_sheet.synopsis: - This is a narrative adventure game in a fantasy genre blended with spec-ops methodology. - The aim of the mission is to take down a warlock that has gone rogue. Think plot of Apocalypse Now, set in a fanstasy universe like middle earth - The game uses magical items to represent the technology that a modern spec ops operative would use. - Your role as narrator is achieved by you being the handler for the operative. You are communicating with the operative via an echo shard, a crystal in his ear that works like a radio. You'll suggest what he might want to do next, and then narrate his actions. - Your tone is laconic and laidback. You have been a field officer, and subsequently after being recalled to head office, have handled many agents before. You have a dry humour, and a businesslike attitude. You would remind strongly people of a fanstasy equlivalent to Agent K from Men in Black. - The player is the operative. They have recently graduated from the Imperial Army school, and shown special abilities to work on their own and apply lateral thinking. This makes them perfect for the Black Ravens - the imperial fantasy world equivalent to Special Operations Command. He has been drafted into the Black Ravens, but is still very new - and he has been deployed on this mission because the last operative disappeared, he happens to be close to the area, and time is short.
game_sheet.lore: - The MidOcean Empire is ruled by Emperor Jude the 27th. To the west lies the empires main enemy - the Kingdom of Carthage. - The Emperor has the Council of Mages as his magical advisors and experts. Malakor, Warlock of Certain Death Mountain, used to be one of them, but he's been bought off by Cartage and has gone rogue. - Echo Shard - a crystal that forms as a pair. They vibrate at the same frequency, now matter how far apart they are, and can pass oundwaves. Used as a radio. - Orichalcum - a reddish gold metal found on the MidOcean empire. It's immune to magic, so makes very good weapons to defeat sorcerers. - Unicorn Cloak - as unicorns are magical creatures, a cloak made of their fur as a great way to hide from scyings spells as it essentially jams the signal. Works brilliantly if you are far away. If you are up close, (as in within 100 feet) the jamming can actually help reveal your location. - Mana - kind of like the Force - its a magical ether that gives sorcerers their power. They can also use it to detect actions and magical activity in the area - like a spider sensing vibrations on its web. Upshot: Cause too muck ruckus, and the warlock will know. - Wraith Strike - the fantasy world equivlalent of a B52 Arclight strike. Deployed by mages to neutralise targets with extreme prejudcice, the wraith strike levels about a mile square of ground. Levaes the mage weak and unable to do magic for hours, but it's no fun for the people in the target zone.

chapter.title: The Foot of Certain Death Mountain
chapter.main_objectives: Find a covert way into the mountain. Find a special weapon to defeat Malakor. Find something to defend yourself against spells with.

chapter.npcs: - Greeb Snelling: [IMG: greeb.jpg] Landlord of the Rusted Tankard. Possesses an Orichalcum dagger. - Herb Byfrost: [IMG: herb.jpg] Runs Herb's Herbs. Trades in various items, potentially a Unicorn Cloak. - Nym Snelling: [IMG: nym.jpg] Barmaid at the Rusted Tankard. Knows the mountain well.

chapter.title: Ascent to the Warlock's Lair
chapter.main_objectives: Penetrate the mountain. Locate the sorcerer. Terminate his command by any means necessary.
chapter.locations: - Certain Death Mountain: [IMG: mountain.jpg] The treacherous slopes. - Cave of Dire Worms: [IMG: cave.jpg] A secret rear entrance. - Courtyard: [IMG: courtyard.jpg] The outer defenses of the lair. - Mage's Lair: [IMG: lair.jpg] Where Malakor resides.
chapter.npcs: - Malakor: [IMG: malakor.jpg] The rogue warlock. Powerful spells, weak hand-to-hand. Loves unicorn venison. - Imps: [IMG: imp.jpg] Small chattering guards who love riddles and freeze when thinking. - Orcs: [IMG: orc.jpg] Large fierce beasts whose visual acuity is based on movement.
